steps.title: Remove your shirt.
steps.content: Remove your shirt. Body sprays for men usually double as deodorants. So it is more effective to use the spray on your body as opposed to your clothes.

steps.title: Spray your upper body.
steps.content: Spray your upper body. Hold the spray can six inches (152 mm) away from your body. Press the spray button and spray your armpits, chest and neck. Spray each body part for only two to three seconds. For more coverage, hold the spray can farther away from your body, like seven to nine inches (178 to 229 mm).

steps.title: Apply the spray once per day.
steps.content: Apply the spray once per day. In general, body sprays have a very strong scent. By applying the spray only once per day, you can avoid overloading your senses, and the senses of the people around you. You also want to avoid over spraying since there may be negative health effects associated with using body sprays excessively. [1] X Research source The only exception is if you plan to exercise or engage in sports or another physical activity that will cause you to perspire. If this is you, then you may re-apply the body spray after the physical activity.

steps.title: Spray your pulse points.
steps.content: Spray your pulse points. [2] X Expert Source Shipra Taneja Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 6 August 2021. Hold the body spray four to five inches (102 to 127 mm) from your pulse points. Spray each pulse point with one spray. Try to avoid rubbing in the spray. Instead, let the body spray soak in and dry on your skin. [3] X Research source Your pulse points include your wrists, the insides of your elbows, the front of your neck, the back of your knees and between your breasts. Your body emits pheromones from pulse points, and these points are excellent places to apply your body spray to ensure the longevity of the scent. [4] X Expert Source Shipra Taneja Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 6 August 2021.

steps.title: Spritz your clothing.
steps.content: Spritz your clothing. Do this once you have spritzed your pulse points. However, hold the spray can seven to nine inches (178 to 229 mm) from your body/clothes. Spritz your top and pants once or twice. [5] X Research source Alternatively, you can spritz the air in front of you and walk through the mist to scent your clothes.

steps.title: Spray your hair.
steps.content: Spray your hair. Try to avoid spraying your hair directly. Instead, spritz the air above you once or twice with the spray. Quickly stand underneath the mist to lightly scent your hair. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Choose a fragrance you like.
steps.content: Choose a fragrance you like. Choose a scent that matches your personal taste and style. Start by sampling popular fragrances to see which scents appeal to your taste. Then explore other fragrances that are made with similar scents. If you are a girl, then you may prefer sweet, floral scents or musky scents. If you are a guy, then you may prefer woodsy or spicy scents.

steps.title: Apply the body spray after you shower.
steps.content: Apply the body spray after you shower. Applying body spray on a clean body will help the scent stick to your body better and last longer. After you shower, lightly towel off. Spritz your damp body with the body spray.

steps.title: Layer fragrances.
steps.content: Layer fragrances. Layering fragrances will also help your body spray last longer. While you are showering, use a body gel that has similar scents to the ones in your body spray. After your shower, apply a lotion with similar scents to your damp body. Once the lotion has dried, spritz your body with the body spray. For example, if your body spray contains vanilla, lavender and mint notes, then choose a body wash and lotion that contains lavender, vanilla or mint to layer with. If you cannot find a complementary lotion or body wash, then use an unscented lotion or soap. Some body sprays come with complementary lotions and body washes.
